macro_markets.query: What are the most important macroeconomic and stock market news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major index movements, Fed/central bank news, and significant company earnings or announcements.

items.title: Wall Street Ends Mixed Friday with Dow Down 0.6% as Intel Tumbles
items.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 285 points (0.6%) to 49,098.71, S&P 500 edged up 0.1% to 6,915.61, and Nasdaq rose 0.3% to 23,501.24 amid mixed trading. Intel weighed heavily on the market while Capital One sank 7.6% on weak profits and CSX gained 2.4% despite lower earnings.

items.title: Major US Indexes Post Small Weekly Declines Ending January 24
items.summary: S&P 500 down 0.4%, Dow -0.5%, Nasdaq -0.1%, Russell 2000 -0.3%, and S&P MidCap 400 -0.6% for the week, reflecting sector rotation to defensives like energy, materials, and staples amid elevated yields and uncertainty.

items.title: US Markets Show Defensive Rotation and Hesitation in Early 2026
items.summary: All major indexes closed the week lower with Dow underperforming due to financial and industrial weakness; Nasdaq outperformed on tech gains but with increased volatility. Investors favor balance sheets over growth amid softening January momentum.

items.title: Natural Gas Futures Surge 62.6% in Record Three-Day Gain to $5.05
items.summary: Front-month Nymex natural gas contract for February delivery hit $5.05 per million BTUs, the biggest three-day percentage gain on record, catching speculators off guard after heavy net short positions.

items.title: Russell 2000 Small Caps Outperform S&P 500 for 14 Straight Sessions
items.summary: Through Thursday, Russell 2000 outperformed S&P 500 for the longest streak since 1996 with seven record highs this year, driven by value and cyclical stocks since early November.

items.title: Capital One Acquires Brex for $5.15 Billion After Weak Q4 Profits
items.summary: Capital One shares sank 7.6% on weaker-than-expected end-2025 profits but announced $5.15 billion cash-and-stock purchase of Brex, a corporate credit card issuer.

items.title: Clorox Buys Purell Maker GOJO Industries for $2.25 Billion
items.summary: Clorox shares rose 1.1% after announcing $2.25 billion cash acquisition of GOJO Industries, the maker of Purell hand sanitizer.

items.title: Japanese 40-Year Bond Yields Spike Above 4% in Historic Jump
items.summary: 40-year Japanese government bond yields crossed 4% for the first time with a 29.7 basis point surge, the largest one-day jump since April.

items.title: Gold Hits Record Near $5,000 per Ounce Amid Safe-Haven Demand
items.summary: Gold prices rose to a new record nearing $5,000/oz on Friday, up nearly 15% year-to-date as investors seek safer assets.

crypto_news.query: What are the most significant cryptocurrency and blockchain news from the past 24 hours? Include major price movements, regulatory news, and notable project developments.

items.title: Global Crypto Market Cap Drops 1.07% to $2.99T as Bitcoin Falls 1.30%
items.summary: Bitcoin traded between $88,136 and $89,676 over the past 24 hours, closing at $88,455, down 1.30%, while most major cryptocurrencies like ETH (-0.87%), BNB (-1.33%), and XRP (-1.29%) also declined. Market outperformers included NOM (+115%), ZKC (+70%), and ENSO (+69%).

items.title: Brazil's Central Bank Issues Guidelines for Crypto Businesses
items.summary: Brazil's Central Bank has released new guidelines regulating crypto businesses, marking a significant step in formalizing the sector within the country's financial framework.

items.title: U.S. Senate Bill Proposes CFTC Oversight of Spot Crypto Markets
items.summary: A new U.S. Senate bill aims to place spot cryptocurrency markets under the oversight of the Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), with an upcoming hearing to address key legislation.

items.title: Oklahoma Bill Proposes Bitcoin Payments for State Employees and Businesses
items.summary: Oklahoma introduces legislation to allow Bitcoin payments for state employees and businesses, promoting crypto adoption at the governmental level.

items.title: Bitcoin Price Analysis: Down 1.33% with Potential Drop to $80,000
items.summary: Bitcoin has declined 1.33% in the last 24 hours and 7.1% over the week, trading at $88,265, with bears in control and a possible test of $86,561 or even $80,000 if the downtrend continues.

items.title: Eric Trump: Sovereign Wealth Funds Turning to Cryptocurrencies Amid Fiat Concerns
items.summary: Eric Trump highlights sovereign wealth funds shifting to cryptocurrencies due to concerns over fiat currencies, amid broader geopolitical tensions influencing global finance.

ai_news.query: What are the most important artificial intelligence and machine learning news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include new model releases, company announcements, research breakthroughs, and industry trends.

items.title: NASA Releases ExoMiner++ AI Model for TESS Exoplanet Data
items.summary: NASA has upgraded its ExoMiner AI model, previously used to validate 370 exoplanets from Kepler data, to now analyze TESS mission data using advanced machine learning techniques.

items.title: Google DeepMind Chief AGI Scientist Shane Legg Hiring Senior Economist for Post-AGI Economy Research
items.summary: Shane Legg, co-founder and chief AGI scientist at Google DeepMind, posted a hiring call for a senior economist to lead research on economic transformations after AGI arrival; Elon Musk suggested using Grok.

items.title: Chennai Student Launches Jal Sarovar AI Platform to Detect Water Contamination
items.summary: Student Samridhi developed Jal Sarovar, an AI and machine learning web platform trained on 50,000 water samples to monitor 40 parameters like pH and TDS, gaining approval for Chennai water data access.

items.title: Meta Positions Itself as AI Infrastructure Giant with Meta Compute Initiative
items.summary: Meta is investing heavily in data centers, chips, and power through Meta Compute, aiming to make these its next strategic advantage in AI infrastructure.

items.title: AI's Threat to Global Labour Intensifies with Major US Layoffs in 2025
items.summary: US firms like UPS (20,000 jobs), Intel (24,000), Microsoft (15,000), and Amazon (14,000) cited AI efficiencies for layoffs; experts predict massive workforce impacts expanding in 2026.

gaming.query: What are the most notable video game and gaming industry news from the past 24 hours? Include game releases, announcements, esports, and industry developments.

items.title: 20+ Games Coming to Xbox Next Week (January 26-30)
items.summary: Xbox highlights upcoming releases including Highguard on January 26, Our Adventurer Guild and Speedball on January 27, Drop Duchy on January 28, and Code Vein 2 on January 29. Xbox Game Pass adds five new titles, including Warhammer 40,000: Space Marine 2.

items.title: Xbox Exec Explains Inconsistent Day-One PS5 Releases
items.summary: Xbox Game Studios head Craig Duncan discusses why some games like Fable launch day-one on PS5 while others like Forza Horizon 6 arrive later due to development realities, promising more consistency in future multi-platform releases.

items.title: Fallout 1 and Fallout 2 Free for Prime Gaming Subscribers Until January 26
items.summary: Prime Gaming members can claim Fallout 1 and Fallout 2 for free until tomorrow, offering classic RPGs at no cost.

items.title: New Free Games Roundup for January 24-25 Weekend
items.summary: A comprehensive list of free-to-keep and free-to-play games across PC, Xbox, PlayStation, and mobile platforms available this weekend.

tech_news.query: What are the most important technology news and developments from the past 24 hours? Include major product launches, company news, and significant tech industry developments. Exclude AI-specific news.
